data.question: What is the chemical formula for the compound with the highest CO2 uptake at 298 K and 1 atm?

Does [Cu(bpy-1)2(SiF6)] have a higher selectivity for CO2 over CH4 compared to [Cu(bpy-2)2(SiF6)]?

What is the CO2 uptake of [Cu(bpy-2)2(SiF6)] at 1 atm?
Does [Cu(bpy-1)2(SiF6)] exhibit a high uptake for H2O?
What is the isosteric heat of adsorption (Qst) for CO2 in [Cu(bpy-1)2(SiF6)]?
Is the surface area of [Cu(bpy-2)2(SiF6)] higher than that of [Cu(bpy-1)2(SiF6)]?
What is the CO2/CH4 selectivity of [Cu(bpy-2)2(SiF6)]?
Does [Cu(bpy-1)2(SiF6)] rely on chemisorption for CO2 uptake?
What is the Qst value for CO2 in [Cu(bpy-2)2(SiF6)]?

What is the synthesis method for [Cu(bpy-1)2(SiF6)]?
data.answer: Layering a solution of CuSiF6 in EtOH/H2O onto a solution of bpy-1 in CHCl3

data.question: What is the synthesis temperature for [Cu(bpy-2)2(SiF6)]?

data.answer: It is premature to assert their role in selectivity
